p: Complex 1 was crystallized by layering a dichloromethane solution with pentane. Single crystals of 2 were obtained by slow evaporation of a pentane solution under argon at 5 °C. The crystal structures are similar to previously reported κ 2‐ C, N‐pyridine bridged di‐iron compounds (Figure 3). 17, 18 The Fe1–Fe2 bond lengths of 1 and 2 are 2.5741(5) and 2.5726(5) Å, respectively. These bonds are slightly longer than the Fe–Fe bond length in [Fe 2( µ‐bdt)(CO) 6] (2.480(2) Å 20) and [Fe 2( µ‐pdt)(CO) 6] (2.5103(11) Å 25). The Fe2–C7 bond length is 1.996(3) Å for 1 and 1.992(2) Å for 2 and this is comparable to the Fe–C bond length in similar κ 2‐ C, N bridged hydrogenase mimics. 17 The Fe1–N1 bond is 1.984(2) for 1 and a little shorter for 2 (1.9744(19) Å).
